basics.name: Aravind Narayanan
basics.label: Engineer
basics.summary: An aspiring engineer with a strong background in Electrical and Computer Engineering, specializing in areas such as deep learning, computer vision, and robotics.

work.name: Neural Robotics Lab
work.summary: Developed a novel pipeline for monocular depth estimation, enabling accurate reconstruction of human-robot walking environments from 2D images.
highlights: Achieved 82.6% accuracy in stair height prediction and 81.4% accuracy in depth estimation.
Collected and made a custom image dataset using Intel RealSense depth cameras.

work.name: Laboratory for Applied Informatics Research
work.summary: Advanced clustering and labeling for the PATTIE database using AI techniques, improving data management and retrieval.
highlights: Enhanced searchability and user experience through refined data categorization.

work.name: Bernhardt-Walther Lab
work.summary: Developed the Python version of the Mid-level Vision Toolbox to extract structural properties from images.
highlights: Engineered and optimized computational tools to facilitate the study of mid-level representations in both biological and artificial vision systems.

work.name: Robotics and Manufacturing Automation Laboratory
work.summary: Developed software for Collaborative Robots, leveraging machine learning and robotics dynamics.
highlights: Designed a manipulator proficient in gesture recognition, obstacle avoidance, and object transfer to humans.

work.name: Center for Computational Social Science
work.summary: Analyzed politicians’ social media use, revealing a strong correlation between Twitter engagement and followers.
highlights: Developed a model using BERT embedding and ML techniques for classification of fraudulent behavior on Play Store.
Presented a poster at 2024 Toronto Robotics Conference.

education.institution: International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad
highlights: Dean’s and Merit List for five semesters
Teacher Assistant for Processor Architecture, Systems Thinking, Probability, and Statistical Methods in AI

projects.name: Lyric Mood Classification with Deep Learning
projects.summary: Led a team comparing deep learning and traditional machine learning approaches for mood classification in song lyrics.
highlights: Achieved an accuracy of 85.2% using a GPT model with word2vec embedding.

projects.name: Autonomous Vehicle Navigation and 3D Environment Mapping
projects.summary: Implemented 2D-SLAM with pose-graph optimization and loop-closure constraints for accurate positioning.
highlights: Employed advanced algorithms for motion planning and collision avoidance in autonomous navigation.

projects.name: Retinal Blood Vessels Segmentation
projects.summary: Built a pipeline for retinal vasculature detection using a morphological hessian-based approach and region-based Otsu thresholding for segmentation and denoising.

projects.name: AI-Driven Health Monitoring System on Google Cloud Platform
projects.summary: Engineered an end-to-end health monitoring system using AI models to analyze respiratory pulse signals and sleep patterns.
highlights: Showcased scalable solutions on cloud platforms.
